Header.title: Your Story Starts With Us
Header.paragraph: People love a good story. But more importantly, people buy from a good story. The best brands are built on great stories.That's why storytelling is the best way to strengthen your brand.

About.paragraph: APESH (Asian Pacific Endowment for Science and Human) sponsors the development of young human resources for developing countries in the Asia Pacific region to research and evaluate the potential for human resource development. initially researched the project 'Building leadership thinking, mastering a new era'.
Why: A playground to explore the potential of themselves
The opportunity to experience trainee management
Experience the real definition of The Leader is what?

Gallery.title: Capacity development programme on air quality management and emission reduction of PM2.5 for ASEAN countries
Enhancing local capacity for implementing transboundary revitalization policies for the Citarum River

As one of the sponsoring organisations of the DIVERSITAS (International Programme of Biodiversity Science) Second Open Science Conference (OSC2), APESH is very pleased that the Conference convened successfully in Cape Town, South Africa on 13-16 October 2009. On behalf of the APESH, Dr. Linda Anne Stevenson, Scientific Officer participated at the OSC2 and below narrative provides highlights of the Conference and APESH’s active participation.
Connecting women-led local realities with the global discourse on climate adaptation and DRR: Interrogating women’s lived experiences in Cambodia and Vanuatu
APESH Collaborates with START for Closer Science-Policy Links in Southeast Asia
Particulate matter source apportionment in Malaysia using source tagging modeling approach to quantify transboundary air pollution: a comparative analysis between haze and non-haze periods
Case study of climate adaptation and disaster risk reduction projects across sectors in Asia-Pacific (2015–2020)
Development of adaptation communication framework mainstreaming indigenous and local knowledge for Hindu-Kush Himalayan regions
Optimizing climate change adaptation through enhanced community resilience

Services.name: Climate
Services.text: The drastic effects of climate change and climate variability pose a significant threat to humanity. We promote regional efforts that contribute to coordinated global climate actions for a sustainable future.

Services.name: Biodiversity and ecosystems
Services.text: A rich biodiversity and healthy ecosystems ensure that nature continues to provide food and water, regulate climate, and protect societies from extreme weather events.

Services.name: Air, land, coasts and oceans
Services.text: Interactions among the land, air, coasts and oceans, whether caused by natural or human factors at different timescales, have profound implications on global environmental change and implications for sustainability.

Services.name: Food, water and energy
Services.text: Ensuring the security and sustainability of food, water and energy, which are interconnected and interdependent in many ways, requires a transdisciplinary approach engaging actors in different sectors.

Services.name: Risk and resilience
Services.text: We encourage countries to work together in deepening our understanding of disaster risks, strengthening capacity to manage those risks, and enhancing preparedness and resilience.

Services.name: Human dimensions
Services.text: Human activities affect and are affected by the Earth's environment. Achieving our vision requires research and capacity development approaches that harness the latest development of social and natural sciences.

Team.name: Regional research
Team.job: Through the competitive Collaborative Regional Research Programme (CRRP), we promote regional research that has potential to improve our understanding of global change and its implications while contributing to a sound scientific basis for policymaking in areas affected by global change.

Team.name: Capacity development
Team.job: Capable, our scientific capacity development programme, aims to enhance the capacity of scientists, policymakers and practitioners to assess global change issues, and explore options to resolve issues towards achieving sustainability. Through Capable, we support activities that enhance capacity at individual, organizational and systemic levels.

Team.name: Science-policy linkages
Team.job: One of our goals is to strengthen interactions among scientists and policymakers. To this end, we work with governments, project teams and international partner organizations to develop policy-relevant knowledge products and create empowering environments conducive to enhancing science-policy interactions.

Team.name: Vision
Team.job: To advance research in all sectors of Social Sciences. To promote publishing of high quality theoretical and empirical research manuscripts. To develop global networks among academicians, researchers and professionals for interaction and mutual cooperation

Features.title: Inbox
Features.text: To send someone a private message on social media.

Features.title: Remote consultation
Features.text: An experienced and trusted person who gives another person advice and help, esp. related to work or school, over a period of time

Features.title: Mentor consulting
Features.text: A person with experience in a job who supports and advises someone with less experience to help them develop in their work.

Features.title: A new lease of life
Features.text: You will become more energetic and active and happiness than before.
